Zelensky without Yermak: The story of a split at the top of Ukraine
byline: By Ariane Chemin (Kyiv (Ukraine), special correspondent) and Thomas d’Istria (Kyiv (Ukraine), correspondent)
subhed: As Ukraine negotiates an end to the war, Volodymyr Zelensky had to part ways with his chief diplomat, Andriy Yermak, a political lightning rod and a close friend. The Ukrainian president is doing everything to downplay the departure of his right-hand man.

byline: By Brice Laemle, Hamid Nasri and Simon Roger
subhed: The journalist, who was sentenced in the first instance to seven years in prison for advocating terrorism, had his sentence upheld by the Tizi Ouzou Court of Appeal on Wednesday.

title: How Edouard Philippe hopes to succeed Macron
byline: By Marie Pouzadoux and Nathalie Segaunes
subhed: Sixteen months ahead of France's presidential election, the center-right former prime minister has been working to establish himself as the natural choice successor to Emmanuel Macron. He has ruled out participating in a primary with other contenders.

title: In Paris, five spots to enjoy a (great) plant-based sandwich
subhed: A 'dwich' with button mushrooms in the style of roast chicken, a Japanese snack with sweet or savory options, a banh mi without meat or Maggi sauce: Here is our selection of Parisian spots to savor delicious vegetarian sandwiches.

title: PFAS: France's tap water is widely polluted with TFA, the most common 'forever chemical'
byline: By Stéphane Mandard and Stéphane Foucart
subhed: A French state health agency analyzed over 600 samples of drinking water. 92% of them contained traces of trifluoroacetic acid (TFA), the smallest PFAS molecule, which is suspected to be toxic.

The significant trade imbalance between France and China
byline: By Harold Thibault (Shanghai (China) special correspondent) and Jordan Pouille (Beijing (China), correspondent)
subhed: Even as Chinese competition increasingly undermines French industries, including in innovation, many French companies argue that maintaining a presence in China remains essential. President Emmanuel Macron is visiting the country from December 3 to 5.

title: Marine Le Pen axes party's vice president
byline: By Clément Guillou and Corentin Lesueur
subhed: David Rachline has resigned from his positions and will not be nominated the party's candidate for mayor in Fréjus, southern France. An image Rachline posted of himself with members of a neo-Nazi group appears to have triggered the fall of a figure already weakened by two corruption investigations.

title: 'Mektoub, My Love: Canto Due': Abdellatif Kechiche's Mediterranean gem
subhed: The director of 'Blue Is the Warmest Color' is releasing the final installment of his trilogy set in Sète, weaving a tale of intrigue and burning desire. It is a film of reconciliations and reunions, with characters who never fail to surprise.
